text: おい、見たかよ / 見た、見た / 何が? / 知らねえのか、あの外人 / 外人? / ああ、2年A組に転校してきたんだよ / 先週
translation: Hey, did you see her? / Yeah, yeah / See what? / Don't you know? That foreigner / Foreigner? / Yeah, she transferred to class 2-A / Last week
grammar: かよ - masculine informal question particle showing surprise or seeking confirmation

text: グー / だよな
translation: Nice / Right?
grammar: だよな - seeking agreement, masculine casual speech

text: ソウリュウアスカラングレって言うんだってさ / マジに可愛いじゃ / 帰国子女だろ / やっぱ住んでんのかな / バカ言え
translation: They say her name is Soryu Asuka Langley / She's seriously cute / She's a returnee, right? / I wonder if she really lives there / Don't be stupid

vocabulary.meaning: person who grew up abroad, returnee
as expected, after all (casual form of やはり)

grammar: って言うんだってさ - hearsay marker (I heard that...); んだ - explanatory んです in casual form

text: きっとドイツでつらい別れがあったんだ / 見知らぬ土地で傷ついた心も癒せずにいるんだよ / お / ー
translation: She must have had a painful separation in Germany / In an unfamiliar land, unable to heal her wounded heart / Oh...

vocabulary.meaning: to be wounded, to be hurt

grammar: んだ - explanatory form expressing conjecture; ずにいる - continuing state of not doing something

text: あーあー / 猫もシャクシも / アスカ。アスカか? / 皆平和なもんや。 / 前取り!
translation: Geez... / Every Tom, Dick, and Harry / Asuka. Asuka, huh? / Everyone's so carefree. / Front and center!

vocabulary.meaning: every Tom, Dick, and Harry; everyone without exception

grammar: もんや - Kansai dialect explanatory ending (standard: ものだ)

text: 写真にあの性格はあらへんからな。
translation: A photo doesn't show that personality of hers.

vocabulary.meaning: doesn't exist (Kansai dialect for ない)

grammar: あらへん - Kansai dialect negative (standard: ない); からな - explanatory with emphasis

text: ヘロー!シンジ! / ゴーテン・モーゲン!
translation: Hello! Shinji! / Guten Morgen!
grammar: Katakana used for foreign words (English 'Hello' and German 'Guten Morgen')

text: ゴ、ゴーテン・モーゲン… / また朝から新規くさい顔して、このあたしが声かけてんのよ。 / ジッターうれしそうな顔しなさいよ。
translation: G-Guten Morgen... / Once again, with that gloomy face in the morning, and I'm the one greeting you. / You should at least look happy.
grammar: てんのよ - contracted form of ているのよ (continuous action + feminine emphasis); しなさいよ - imperative + feminine particle

text: で、ここにいるんでしょ?もう一人 / 誰が?
translation: So, she's here, right? The other one / Who?

vocabulary.meaning: one more person, the other person

grammar: んでしょ - contracted form of のでしょう (seeking confirmation)

text: あんたバカ?ファーストチルドレーに決まってるじゃない / ああ、綾波なら
translation: Are you stupid? It's obviously the First Children / Oh, if you mean Ayanami...

vocabulary.word: ファーストチルドレー
vocabulary.reading: ふぁーすとちるどれー

grammar: に決まってるじゃない - it's obviously..., it must be... (strong assertion)

text: ハロー! / あなたが綾波レイね、プロトタイプのパイロット
translation: Hello! / You're Ayanami Rei, right? The prototype's pilot
grammar: ね - sentence-final particle seeking confirmation or agreement

text: 私、アスカ、双流アスカラングレー / エヴァ2号機のパイロット / 仲良くしましょう / どうして? / その方が都合がいいからよ / いろいろとね
translation: I'm Asuka, Soryu Asuka Langley / Pilot of Eva Unit-02 / Let's be friends / Why? / Because it's more convenient that way / In various ways
grammar: しましょう - volitional form (let's...); 方が - comparative (more...)

text: 命令があればそうするわ / 変わったかねえ / ほんま、エヴァのパイロットって / 変わり者が選ばれるんちゃうか?
translation: If there's an order, I'll do so / She's odd, isn't she? / Seriously, Eva pilots... / Aren't they all weirdos who get selected?

vocabulary.meaning: to be chosen, to be selected
isn't it? (Kansai dialect for じゃないか)

grammar: があれば - conditional (if there is...); んちゃうか - Kansai dialect conjecture (standard: のではないか)

text: 少し痩せたかな / そう / 悲しい恋をしてるからだ / どうして / そんなことがわかるの
translation: Have you lost a little weight? / Really? / It's because you're having a sad romance / How do you / know something like that?

vocabulary.meaning: to lose weight, to become thin

grammar: たかな - past tense + かな (wondering if...); からだ - explanatory (it's because...)

text: それはね / 涙の通り道にほくろのある人は
translation: Well, you see / People who have a mole on the path of tears...
grammar: それはね - explanatory opening (well, you see...); にある - existence at a location

text: 一生泣き続ける運命にあるからだよ / これからくどくつもり / でもダメよ / 怖い お姉さんが見ているわ
translation: ...are destined to cry for their entire lives / Are you planning to hit on her now? / But that's no good / A scary big sister is watching

vocabulary.meaning: to court, to woo, to hit on

grammar: にある - to be in a state of; つもり - intention (planning to...)

text: お久しぶり カジ君 / いや しばらく
translation: Long time no see, Kaji-kun / Yeah, it's been a while
grammar: お久しぶり - polite greeting for meeting after a long time (full form: お久しぶりです)

text: しかし カジ君も意外とうかつね / こいつのバカは相変わらずなのよ / あんた 2号機の引き渡し済んだんなら さっさと帰りなさいよ / 今朝 執行の事例が届いたね
translation: However, Kaji-kun, you're surprisingly careless / This idiot is as foolish as ever / If you've finished the Unit-02 handover, hurry up and go home / The assignment notice arrived this morning
grammar: 済んだんなら - conditional (if...has finished); さっさと - quickly, hurriedly (onomatopoeia)

text: ここに居続けだよ / また3人でつるめるな / 昔みたいに / 誰があんたなんかと / 敵襲!?
translation: I'll be staying here / We can hang out together again, the three of us / Just like the old days / Who would hang out with you? / Enemy attack!?

vocabulary.meaning: to hang out together, to stick together

grammar: 続ける - continuation verb; みたいに - like, similar to; なんかと - dismissive particle (with someone like...)

text: 警戒中の巡洋艦、春名寄りに入電。我、キー半島を聞いて巨大な閃光物体を発見。データを送る。 / 受信データを称号。波長パターン青。湿度確認。
translation: Message from patrol cruiser Haruna. Detected massive luminescent object approaching Kii Peninsula. Sending data. / Analyzing received data. Wave pattern blue. Confirming Angel.
grammar: 中の - in the middle of (doing); を聞いて - te-form of 聞く used for sequential action

text: 総員、第一種戦闘配置。
translation: All hands, battle stations first class.
grammar: Military command structure - noun phrases without particles for brevity

text: さきの戦闘によって第三神闘教師の迎撃システムは大きなダメージを受け
translation: Due to the previous battle, Tokyo-3's intercept system suffered major damage
grammar: によって - by means of, due to; を受け - te-form of 受ける (to receive)

text: 現在までの復旧率は26% / 実戦における稼働率はゼロと言っていいわ
translation: Recovery rate to date is 26% / The operational rate in actual combat can be said to be zero
grammar: における - in, at (formal); と言っていい - can say that, it's fair to say

text: したがって今回は上陸直前の目標を水際で一気に叩く
translation: Therefore, this time we'll strike the target at the water's edge in one blow just before it lands
grammar: 直前の - immediately before; で - location particle; に - adverbial particle with 一気

text: 初号機並びに2号機は交互に目標に対し波状攻撃 / 近接戦闘で行くわよ / 了解
translation: Unit-01 and Unit-02 will conduct alternating wave attacks against the target / We'll go with close combat / Roger
grammar: に対し - toward, against; で行く - to go with, to proceed with

text: ああ、日本でのデビュー戦だっていうのに、どうして私一人に任せてくれない / の?
translation: Ugh, even though this is my debut battle in Japan, why won't they let me handle it alone?
grammar: 〜だっていうのに - 'even though', emphasizes contrast between expectation and reality

text: 仕方ないよ、作戦なんだから / 言っとくけど、くれぐれも足手まといになるようなことはしないでね
translation: It can't be helped, it's the operation plan. / Let me tell you, don't you dare become a burden.
grammar: 〜なんだから - 'because it is', emphasizes reason; 言っとく - contraction of 言っておく (saying in advance)

text: なんであんなのがパイロットに選ばれたの?
translation: Why was someone like that chosen as a pilot?
grammar: あんなの - dismissive demonstrative pronoun 'someone/something like that'

text: 二人がかりなんて、ひきようでやだな。趣味じゃない。
translation: Two people ganging up... that's cowardly and I don't like it. It's not my style.
grammar: 〜がかり - 'involving (number) of people'; やだ - casual/feminine form of 嫌だ

text: 私たちは選ぶ余裕なんてないのよ。生き残るための手段はね。
translation: We don't have the luxury of choosing. Not when it comes to the means of survival.
grammar: 〜なんてない - 'there's no such thing as'; 〜ための - 'for the purpose of'

text: 来た!
translation: It's here!
grammar: Past tense た used for completed action with present relevance

text: 攻撃開始 / じゃあ、あたしから行くわ、 / 援護してね / え、援護? / レディーサントよ
translation: Begin attack. / Then I'll go first. / Cover me, okay? / Huh, cover? / Ladies first.
grammar: 〜から行く - 'I'll go (first)'; あたし - feminine first person pronoun

text: って、後から来たくせにしきんのやな
translation: Hey, even though you came later, you're taking command, huh?
grammar: 〜くせに - 'even though/despite' with critical nuance; やな - Kansai dialect for だな

text: 行ける / え!?
translation: I can do it! / What!?

vocabulary.meaning: can do it, can go (potential form)

grammar: 行ける - potential form of 行く, here meaning 'I can do it/make it work'

text: お見事…
translation: Magnificent...
grammar: お〜 - honorific prefix adding politeness or admiration

text: どう?サードチルドレ。 / 戦いは常に無駄なく美しくよ。
translation: How's that, Third Children? / Battle should always be efficient and beautiful.
grammar: 〜なく - negative adverbial form 'without'; よ - feminine/assertive sentence-final particle

text: なんてインチキン
translation: What a cheat...
grammar: なんて - 'what a...!' exclamatory; ン at end is dialect/casual form

text: 本日午前10時58分15秒 / 2体に分離した目標高の攻撃を受けた初号機は / 鶴ヶ湾沖合2キロの海上に水没
translation: Today at 10:58:15 AM. Unit-01, which received an attack from Target A that split into two bodies, has submerged in the ocean 2 km offshore from Tsuruga Bay.
grammar: 〜を受ける - 'to receive' (here: to receive an attack); 〜に水没 - 'submerged in'

text: 同20秒、2号機は目標オツの攻撃により活動停止
translation: At 20 seconds past, Unit-02 ceased operation due to an attack from Target B.
grammar: 〜により - 'due to, by means of' (formal causative); 同〜 - 'same (time period)'

text: この状況に対するE計画責任者のコメント / 無様ね
translation: Comment from the Project E director regarding this situation. / Pathetic.
grammar: 〜に対する - 'regarding, concerning'; ね - feminine assertive particle

text: もう、あんたのせいでせっかくのデビュー戦がめちゃめちゃになっちゃったじゃない / 何言ってんだよ、僧侶が間抜けなことをしただけじゃないか
translation: Geez, because of you my precious debut battle became a total mess! / What are you saying? You're the one who did something stupid.
grammar: 〜のせいで - 'because of, due to (blame)'; 〜ちゃった - contraction of てしまった (regrettable completion); 〜だけ - 'just, only'

text: 間抜け?どうしてグズなあんたがそんなこと言えるのよ、ずーずーしいわね / なんだよ、焦って倒そうとするから大変なことになるんだろ / 何よあれ、海の中 / でドライモンみたいに
translation: Stupid? How can a slowpoke like you say such a thing? You've got some nerve. / What? It's because you rushed to defeat it that things got terrible. / What about you, in the ocean, like a drowned rat.
grammar: 〜て言える - 'can say'; 〜から - 'because' (casual); 〜ようとする - 'try to do'

text: ああ、死ぬなんて、トロボバややくさに!
translation: Ugh, to think I almost died, you slowpoke idiot!
grammar: 〜なんて - 'such a thing as'; トロボバ - slurred/emotional speech combining insults

text: 国連第二方面軍に指揮権を譲渡 / まったく恥をかかせおって
translation: Command authority transferred to UN Second Regional Army. / Good grief, making us lose face like this.

vocabulary.meaning: to be embarrassed, to lose face

grammar: 〜おって - archaic/masculine causative-receptive ending expressing frustration

text: ドー05分、N2爆雷により目標を攻撃
translation: At plus 05 minutes, target attacked by N2 depth charges.
grammar: 〜により - 'by means of' (formal); ドー - military time notation 'plus'

text: また地図を書き直さなきゃならんな / 厚生物質の28%を焼却に成功 / 足 / 止めに過ぎん、再度進行は時間の問題だ
translation: We'll have to redraw the map again. / Successfully incinerated 28% of the biological matter. / It's merely a delaying action. Resuming advance is just a matter of time.
grammar: 〜なきゃならん - casual/masculine 'must do'; 〜に過ぎない - 'nothing more than, merely'

text: ま、立て直しの時間が稼げただけでも儲けものっすよ / いいか、君たち
translation: Well, just being able to buy time for recovery is a gain. / Listen up, you two.
grammar: 〜だけでも - 'even just'; っすよ - casual/masculine copula contraction of です

text: 君たちの仕事は何だかわかるか / エヴァの操縦 / 違う / 使徒に勝つことだ / こんな集大を晒すために我々ネルフは存在しているわけではない / そのためには君たちが協力し合って
translation: Do you understand what your job is? / Piloting Eva. / Wrong. / It's to defeat the Angels. / NERV doesn't exist to expose such disgrace. / For that, you two must cooperate.
grammar: 〜わけではない - 'it's not that...'; 〜し合う - 'to do mutually/together'

text: なんでこんな奴と / もういい
translation: Why with someone like this... / That's enough.
grammar: なんで - casual 'why'; もういい - 'that's enough, stop'

text: どうしてみんなすぐに怒るの / 大人は恥をかきたくないのさ
translation: Why does everyone get angry so quickly? / Adults don't want to be embarrassed.
grammar: 〜たくない - negative desire 'don't want to'; のさ - explanatory masculine ending

text: あのミサトさんは / 後片付け / 責任者は責任取るためにいるからな
translation: What about Misato? / Cleaning up the aftermath. / Those in charge exist to take responsibility, after all.
grammar: 〜ためにいる - 'exist for the purpose of'; からな - explanatory 'because, you know'

text: 関係各省からの抗議文と被害報告書 / で、これがUNからの請求書
translation: Letters of protest and damage reports from all related ministries. / And this is the invoice from the UN.
grammar: 〜からの - 'from (institution/place)'; で - transitional particle 'and, so'

text: 広報部からの苦情もあるわよ / ちゃんと目通しといてね
translation: There's also a complaint from the PR department. / Make sure you look through them properly.

vocabulary.meaning: to look through, to read over

grammar: 〜といて - contraction of ておいて 'do in advance/make sure to do'; ちゃんと - 'properly, correctly'

text: 読まなくても分かってるわよ / 喧嘩をするならここでやれって言うんでしょ / ごめん、サッツ / 言われなくったって / 使徒が片付けばここでやるわよ
translation: I know even without reading them. / They're saying if we're going to fight, do it here, right? / Sorry, Ritsuko. / Even without being told. / Once the Angel is dealt with, we'll do it here.

vocabulary.meaning: to be settled, to be finished

grammar: 〜なくても - 'even without'; 〜なら - conditional 'if'; 〜って言う - quotative 'they say'; 〜なくったって - emphatic 'even without'; 〜ば - conditional 'when/if'

text: 使徒は必ず私が倒すわ / 副司令官はカンカンよ / 今度恥かかせたらさせんね間違いなく
translation: I will definitely defeat the Angel. / The Vice-Commander is furious. / If you embarrass him again, you're fired for sure.
grammar: 〜たら - conditional 'if'; 間違いなく - 'without a doubt, certainly'

text: あのミサトさんは / 後片付け / 責任者は責任取るためにいるからな
translation: What about Misato? / She's cleaning up the mess. / The person in charge exists to take responsibility.
grammar: ~ためにいる - exists for the purpose of (indicating someone's role or purpose)

text: 関係各省からの抗議文と被害報告書 / で、これがUNからの請求書
translation: Letters of protest from various ministries and damage reports. / And this is the bill from the UN.
grammar: ~からの - from (indicating source/origin of documents)

text: 広報部からの苦情もあるわよ / ちゃんと目通しといてね
translation: There's also a complaint from the PR department. / Make sure you read through them properly.

vocabulary.meaning: to look over, to read through

grammar: ~といてね - make sure to do~ (casual request using ~ておく in casual form)

text: 読まなくても分かってるわよ / 喧嘩をするならここでやれって言うんでしょ / ごめん、サッツ / 言われなくったって / 使徒が片付けばここでやるわよ
translation: I know even without reading them. / They're saying if we're going to fight, do it here, right? / Sorry, Ritsuko. / Even without being told... / Once the Angel is taken care of, we'll do it here.

vocabulary.meaning: to tidy up, to finish, to deal with

grammar: ~なくても - even without doing~; ~なくったって - casual form of ~なくても (even without); ~ば - conditional if/when

text: 使徒は必ず私が倒すわ / 副司令官はカンカンよ / 今度恥かかせたらさせんね間違いなく
translation: I will definitely defeat the Angel. / The Vice Commander is furious. / If you embarrass him again next time, you'll be fired for sure.
grammar: ~たら - conditional if/when; させんね likely means 左遷 (demotion/reassignment)

text: 怒り主連が留守だったのは不幸中の幸いだったけどさ / いたら即刻首よこれを見ることもなくね
translation: It was a blessing in disguise that the Commander was away. / If he had been here, you'd have been fired immediately without even seeing this.

vocabulary.reading: ふこうちゅうのさいわい

grammar: ~たら - conditional if; ~こともなく - without even doing~

text: で私の首が繋がるアイディア持ってきてくれたんでしょ / 一つだけね
translation: So you brought me an idea to save my neck, right? / Just one.

vocabulary.meaning: to keep one's job, to save one's neck

grammar: ~てくれたんでしょ - you did~ for me, right? (seeking confirmation); だけ - only, just

text: さすが限りつか博士持つべきも / のは心優しき給油ね
translation: As expected of Dr. Akagi. What one should have is... / a kind-hearted friend.
grammar: 持つべきものは~ - what one should have is~; ~き - classical attributive form creating poetic/formal tone

text: 残念ながら給油のピンチを救うのは私じゃないわ
translation: Unfortunately, I'm not the one who will save you from this crisis.
grammar: ~のは私じゃない - it's not me who~ (contrasting emphasis using のは)

text: このアイディアはカジ君よ / カジノ?
translation: This idea is from Kaji. / Kaji?
grammar: ~は~よ - topic marker with explanatory よ for emphasis

text: ただいまーって言ったって誰もいないか
translation: Even if I say 'I'm home,' there's no one here anyway.
grammar: ~って言ったって - even if I say~; ~か - rhetorical question marker (confirming to oneself)

text: な、なんだこれ / 失礼ね、あたしの荷物よ
translation: Wh-what is this? / How rude! It's my luggage.
grammar: なんだこれ - what is this? (masculine casual); 失礼ね - how rude! (ね adds indignation)

text: ん、なんだソウリュウがここにいるんだよ / あんたこそまだいたの / まだって
translation: Huh, why is Soryu here? / What about you? You're still here? / 'Still'?
grammar: なんで~んだ - why is it that~; あんたこそ - you're the one (emphatic reversal); まだって - repeating with surprise/questioning

text: あんた今日からお払い箱よ / え? / あ
translation: As of today, you're getting the boot. / Huh? / Ah...
grammar: ~から - from/starting from (temporal marker); お払い箱 - idiomatic expression for dismissal

text: リサトはあたしと暮らすの / まあどっちが優秀かを考えれば当然の選択よね
translation: Misato is going to live with me. / Well, considering which of us is superior, it's a natural choice.

vocabulary.meaning: to live, to make a living

grammar: ~を考えれば - if you consider~; ~の - explanatory の (that's how it is)

text: 本当はカジさんと一緒の方がいいんだけど / しかしどうして日本の部屋ってこう狭いのかしら / 荷物が半分も入らないじゃない / あ
translation: Actually I'd prefer to be with Kaji-san, but... / But why are Japanese rooms so cramped? / I can't even fit half my luggage! / Ah...
grammar: ~方がいい - it's better to~; ~って - casual quotative/topic marker; ~じゃない - negative with complaint tone

text: おまけに / どうしてこう日本人って危機感足りないのかしら / よくこんな鍵のない部屋で暮らせるわね / 信じらんない / 日本人の心情は察しと思いやりだからよ
translation: On top of that... / Why do Japanese people lack such a sense of danger? / How can you live in a room without locks like this? / Unbelievable! / It's because the Japanese mentality is about consideration and compassion.

vocabulary.meaning: on top of that, in addition

grammar: どうして~のかしら - I wonder why~; ~られる - potential form (can~); 信じらんない - contracted casual form of 信じられない

text: ミサトさん / おかえりなさい / 早速うまくやってるじゃない / 何がですか / 今度の作戦準備 / どうして
translation: Misato-san! / Welcome back. / You're already getting along well, aren't you? / Getting along with what? / Preparing for the upcoming operation. / How so?
grammar: ~てるじゃない - you're doing~, aren't you?; 何がですか - what (specifically)?

text: 第7使徒の弱点は一つ / 分離中のコアに対する2点同時の荷重攻撃 / これしかないわ
translation: The 7th Angel has one weakness. / A simultaneous two-point concentrated attack on its core during separation. / This is the only way.
grammar: ~中 - during/in the middle of; ~に対する - toward/against; これしかない - this is the only (way)

text: つまりエヴァ2体のタイミングを完璧に合わせた攻撃よ
translation: In other words, an attack with the timing of the two Evas perfectly synchronized.

vocabulary.meaning: in other words, that is to say

grammar: ~を合わせた - synchronized/matched (past participle modifying noun)

text: そのためには2人の協調完璧なユニゾーンが必要なの
translation: For that, we need perfect unison between the two of you through cooperation.

vocabulary.meaning: for that purpose, to that end

grammar: ~ためには - in order to~; explanatory の at end

text: そこであなたたちにこれから一緒に暮らしてもらうわ / えぇー
translation: So I'm going to have you two live together from now on. / Whaaaat?!
grammar: ~てもらう - to have someone do something (for speaker's benefit)

text: 嫌よ昔から男女7歳にして同金せずってね
translation: No way! There's an old saying: boys and girls should not sit together after age seven.

vocabulary.meaning: men and women, boys and girls

grammar: ~にして - at/upon (age); ~せず - classical negative form (not doing); ~ってね - you know, they say

text: 使徒は現在自己修復中第2波は6日後時間がないの / そんな無茶な
translation: The Angel is currently self-repairing. The second wave will come in 6 days. We don't have time. / That's absurd!
grammar: ~中 - in the middle of; ~後 - after (time period); 時間がない - there's no time

text: そこで無茶を可能にする方法 / 二人の完璧なユニゾーンをマスターするため / この曲に合わせた攻撃パターンを覚え込むのよ
translation: So here's a method to make the impossible possible. / To master perfect unison between you two... / You'll memorize attack patterns synchronized to this song.
grammar: ~にする - to make into; ~ため - for the purpose of; ~に合わせた - synchronized to/matched with

text: 6日以内に1秒でも早く
translation: As soon as possible, within 6 days
grammar: でも after a question word (1秒でも) means 'even one/any', emphasizing the minimal amount

text: しかしシンジのやつどないしたんやろ / 学校休んでもう3日か
translation: But I wonder what happened to Shinji / Already 3 days absent from school, huh
grammar: Kansai dialect: どない = どう (how/what), やろ = だろう (I wonder). もう adds emphasis 'already'

text: あれ、委員長やんか / サ / ンバカトリオの二人 / なんで委員長がここにおるんや / ソウリュウさんのお見舞い / あなたたちこそどうしてここに / ヒカリ君のお見舞い / なんでここ / で泊まるんだ
translation: Oh, it's the class representative / Sa- / You two from the Stooges trio / Why is the class rep here / Visiting Soryu / Why are you here / Visiting Hikari / Why are you / staying here
grammar: やんか (Kansai) = じゃないか. こそ adds contrastive emphasis 'you of all people'. おる (Kansai) = いる

text: はーい
translation: Yes!
grammar: Extended はーい shows casual/cheerful response

text: 裏切りもん / またしても今どきペアルック / いやーんな感じ。 / こ、 / これは日本人は形から入る / ものだって。 / 無理やりミサトさんは。
translation: Traitor / And now, matching outfits of all things / Ugh, what a feeling. / Th- / This is because Japanese people start from appearances. / Misato-san forced us.
grammar: もん (Kansai) = もの (person). またしても emphasizes repetition/exasperation. って quotative particle for hearsay

text: うけつよ!二人とも! / ご、誤解だよ! / 誤解は6回もないわ! / いらっしゃい。 / え?
translation: That's hilarious! Both of you! / It's, it's a misunderstanding! / Misunderstandings don't happen 6 times! / Welcome. / Huh?

vocabulary.meaning: to be funny, to get a laugh

grammar: うける (slang) means something is funny/amusing. 6回も emphasizes 'as many as 6 times', suggesting impossibility

text: これは、どういうことか説明してください。
translation: Please explain what this is all about.

vocabulary.meaning: what kind of, what sort of

grammar: どういうことか creates an embedded question 'what kind of thing this is'

text: そーとん、はよ言うてくれたらよかったのに。 / で、ユニゾーはうまくいってるんですか?
translation: Soryu, you should have told us earlier. / So, is the unison training going well?
grammar: たらよかったのに expresses regret 'it would have been good if...'. Kansai: はよ=早く, 言うて=言って

text: それは見ての通りなのよ。
translation: It's just as you can see.

vocabulary.meaning: as you can see, just as it appears

grammar: 見ての通り is a set phrase meaning 'as you can see'. の nominalizes, よ adds assertion

text: あったりまえじゃない / このシンジに合わせてレベル下げるなんて / うまくいくわけないわ / 土台無理な話なのよ / じゃあやめとく
translation: Of course not / Having to lower my level to match this Shinji / There's no way it'll go well / It's impossible from the start / Then I'll quit

vocabulary.meaning: to quit, to stop (colloquial for やめておく)

grammar: わけない expresses impossibility 'there's no way/reason that...'. なんて belittles 'something like...'

text: 他に人いないんでしょ
translation: There's no one else, right?
grammar: んでしょ contracts のでしょう, seeking confirmation with slight challenge/sarcasm

text: レイ / はい / やってみて / はい
translation: Rei / Yes / Try it / Yes
grammar: てみて is て-form of てみる (try doing), used as command. Brief はい shows compliance

text: これは作戦変更してレイと組んだ方がいいかもね
translation: Maybe it would be better to change the strategy and pair up with Rei

vocabulary.meaning: to team up, to pair up

grammar: した方がいい expresses recommendation/better option. かもね softens with uncertainty and ね seeks agreement

text: もう嫌!やってらんないわ!
translation: I've had enough! I can't deal with this anymore!

vocabulary.meaning: can't deal with it (colloquial for やっていられない)

grammar: やってらんない is casual contraction of やっていられない expressing inability to continue tolerating something

text: アスカス! / 鬼 / の目にも涙や / イカーリーくーん
translation: Asuka! / Even demons / shed tears / Ikari-kun!
grammar: 鬼の目にも涙 is a proverb meaning 'even demons cry' (even the harshest person shows emotion). や (Kansai) = だ

text: 追いか / けて / 女の子泣かせたのよ / 責任取りなさいよ
translation: Go after / her / You made a girl cry / Take responsibility
grammar: 泣かせた is causative past 'made (someone) cry'. なさい is imperative command form. のよ adds feminine assertion

text: 何も言わないで
translation: Don't say anything
grammar: ないで is negative te-form making a request/command 'don't do'. 何も with negative means 'nothing at all'

text: 分かってるわ / 私はエヴァに乗るしかないのよ
translation: I know / I have no choice but to pilot Eva

vocabulary.meaning: have no choice but, only option

grammar: しかない expresses 'no choice but to...'. のよ is feminine assertive ending particle

text: やるわ私
translation: I'll do it
grammar: やるわ with わ shows feminine determination. 私 at end emphasizes the subject 'I (will do it)'

text: こうなったら何としてもレイやミサトを見返してやるのよ / そんな見返したなんて
translation: Now that it's come to this, I'll show Rei and Misato no matter what / Something like getting revenge...

vocabulary.meaning: now that it's come to this, in this situation
no matter what, by all means
to show someone up, to prove someone wrong

grammar: やる after verb adds nuance of doing something to/for someone (sometimes negatively). なんて belittles the concept

text: 何甘いこと言ってんのよ男のくせに / 傷つけられた
translation: What are you saying such weak things for, even though you're a guy / When you've been hurt
grammar: 言ってんのよ contracts 言っているのよ. くせに criticizes despite condition. られた is passive 'was hurt'

text: プライドは10倍にして返してやるのよ
translation: You pay back wounded pride tenfold
grammar: にして marks the manner/state 'as 10 times'. やる adds nuance of doing to someone. のよ is assertive

text: ミサトは? / 仕事 / 今夜は徹夜だって / さっき電話が
translation: Where's Misato? / Work / She said she's pulling an all-nighter tonight / She called just now
grammar: だって is casual quotation marker 'she said that...'. Truncated sentences are common in casual conversation

text: じゃあ今夜は二人っきりってわけね / ん?
translation: So that means it's just the two of us tonight / Hm?

vocabulary.meaning: just the two of us, alone together

grammar: っきり suffix means 'just/only'. ってわけ contracts というわけ 'it means that...'. ね seeks confirmation

text: これは決して崩れることのないジェリコの壁! / はぁ… / この壁をちょっとでも超えたら死刑よ! / 子供は夜更かししないで寝なさい!
translation: This is the impregnable Wall of Jericho! / *sigh*... / If you cross this wall even a little bit, it's the death penalty! / Children shouldn't stay up late, go to sleep!
grammar: ことのない creates a noun phrase 'that won't collapse'. たら conditional 'if you do...'. なさい is imperative command form

text: どうして日本人は床の上で寝られるのかしら? / 信じらんない!
translation: How can Japanese people sleep on the floor? / I can't believe it!
grammar: 寝られる uses potential form られる indicating ability. のかしら is a feminine sentence ending expressing wonder or puzzlement.

text: 自分だって子供のくせ
translation: She's a child herself, though.
grammar: くせに (often written くせ when sentence ends) expresses criticism - 'even though/despite being X'. だって emphasizes 'also/too'.

text: 君の唇と君の言葉、どっちを信用したらいいのかな?
translation: Your lips and your words - which should I believe?
grammar: 〜たらいいのかな uses conditional たら + いい (should) + のかな (wondering/uncertain question). Creates a contemplative tone.

text: はい。
translation: Yes.
grammar: Simple affirmative response.

text: ありがとう。今日は珍しくシラフじゃない? / うーん。どっちね、仕事?それとも男? / いろいろ。 / う / ーん。
translation: Thank you. You're unusually sober today, aren't you? / Hmm. Which is it - work? Or a man? / Various things. / Hmm.
grammar: 珍しく uses adverbial form of い-adjective (〜く). じゃない is casual negative copula used as tag question here.

text: まだ好きなのかしら? / え、変なこと言わないでよ!誰が、あんな奴と。
translation: I wonder if she still likes him? / Huh? Don't say weird things! Who would, with that guy...
grammar: のかしら is feminine wondering expression. 〜ないでよ is casual negative request ('don't do X'). Sentence trails off implying denial.

text: いくら若気のいたりとはいえ、あんなのと付き合っていたなんて、我が人生最大の汚点だ / わ。 / 私が言ったのはカジ君がよ / 動揺させちゃった? / あんたねえ
translation: Even if it was youthful indiscretion, the fact that I dated someone like that is the biggest stain on my life. / I was talking about Kaji. / Did I upset you? / Hey, you...
grammar: いくら〜とはいえ means 'even though/although'. 〜ていた is past progressive. 〜ちゃった is casual contraction of てしまった (completed action).

text: 怒るのはズボシをつかれた証拠よ
translation: Getting angry is proof that I hit the mark.
grammar: 〜のは nominalizes the verb (turning 'to get angry' into 'getting angry'). 〜をつかれた is passive form ('to be hit with').

text: 今度はもう少し素直になったら? / 8年前とは違うんだから / 変わってないわ / ちっとも / 大人になってない / さて / しごとしごと
translation: Why don't you be a bit more honest this time? / It's different from 8 years ago. / You haven't changed at all. / Not one bit. / You haven't become an adult. / Well then / work, work.
grammar: 〜たら? is casual suggestion ('why don't you'). んだから gives reason/explanation. ちっとも requires negative verb to mean 'not at all'.

text: 明日は決戦だもんね
translation: Tomorrow is the decisive battle, after all.
grammar: だもんね is casual contraction of だものね, expressing shared understanding or seeking agreement ('after all/you know').

text: 目標はゴーラ絶対防衛戦を突破 / 来たわね / 今度は抜かりないわよ
translation: The target has broken through the absolute defense line at Gora. / Here it comes. / This time there won't be any slip-ups.
grammar: 〜を突破 uses を particle with する verb (突破する). 抜かりない means 'there are no oversights' (抜かり + ない).

text: 音楽スタートと同時にATフィールドを展開 / あとは作戦通りに / 2人ともいいわね / 了解 / 目標は三冠振入 / いいわね
translation: Deploy the AT Field simultaneously with the music start. / After that, follow the operation plan. / Both of you, understood? / Roger. / Target is entering Sangai Valley. / Understood?
grammar: 〜と同時に means 'simultaneously with'. 〜通りに means 'according to/following'. いいわね seeks confirmation.

text: 最初からフルカド、最大戦速で行くわよ! / 分かってるよ。62秒で蹴りを / つける。 / 目標!ゼロ地点に到達します!
translation: We're going full throttle from the start, at maximum combat speed! / I know. We'll finish it in 62 seconds. / Target! Reaching zero point!
grammar: 〜から means 'from'. で indicates means/method. 蹴りをつける is idiom meaning 'to finish/settle something'.

text: 外電源、パーディング。発進。
translation: External power, purging. Launch.
grammar: Technical/military terminology. Short declarative statements typical of operation commands.

text: エヴァリオキ確認!
translation: Eva startup confirmed!
grammar: リオキ is likely 起動 (きどう) in katakana/garbled. 確認 used as noun in technical context.

text: おーちゃー! / うざまね
translation: Oh no! / Same here!
grammar: Exclamatory expressions. うざまね appears to be colloquial/slurred speech.

text: ちょっと! / あたしの2号機になんてことすんなよ!
translation: Hey! / What are you doing to my Unit-02!
grammar: なんてことすんなよ is rough/casual speech: なんてこと (what kind of thing) + する (do) + な (don't) + よ (emphasis). Masculine ending.

text: そんな!そっちがつかがってきたんじゃないか! / 最後にタイミング外したの!そっちでしょ! / 普段からポケポケっとしてるからよ! / 昨日の夜だって寝ないで何してたの?
translation: That's not true! You're the one who grabbed on! / You're the one who missed the timing at the end! / It's because you're always spacing out! / What were you doing last night instead of sleeping?
grammar: 〜んじゃないか is assertive ('isn't it that...'). 〜でしょ seeks agreement. 〜からよ gives reason with feminine ending. だって emphasizes 'even'.

text: 今日も戦いのためのイメージトライニング / だよ! / 嘘ばっかし!寝てるスキンに私のくつける奪おうとしたくせに! / つるいよ!起きてたなんて! / ひどーい! / 冗談で言った
translation: Image training for today's battle! / You're such a liar! You tried to steal my lips while I was sleeping! / That's mean! You were awake! / How terrible! / I said it as a joke.
grammar: 〜ばっかし is casual form of ばかり ('nothing but'). 〜スキンに means 'while/when'. 〜くせに means 'even though/despite'. 〜なんて expresses disbelief.

text: だけなのに本当だったの?キスしたのね! / してないよ!途中でやめたんだよ!
translation: It was just that, but was it true? You kissed her! / I didn't! I stopped midway!
grammar: 〜だけなのに means 'even though it was just'. 〜のね seeks confirmation with surprise. 〜んだよ explains/emphasizes ('I'm telling you').

text: 部下直前の使徒が眠る浅間さん加工 / 極地仕様のエヴァ2号機が灼熱の地獄へ挑む
translation: The angel sleeping in Mt. Asama just before hatching. / The polar-spec Eva Unit-02 challenges the scorching hell.
grammar: 〜直前 means 'just before'. が marks subject. 〜へ挑む means 'to challenge/take on'.

text: 次回マグマダイバー / この次もサービスサービス
translation: Next episode: Magma Diver. / Next time, service, service!
grammar: Standard preview format. サービス repeated for emphasis - refers to 'fan service' content.

text: ご視聴ありがとうございました
translation: Thank you for watching.

vocabulary.word: ありがとうございました
vocabulary.reading: ありがとうございました

grammar: ご〜 is honorific prefix. 〜ました is polite past form. Standard end-of-broadcast phrase.
